examples: a clamor of children at play

definition: insistent public expression (as of support or protest)
examples: the current clamor about what is wrong with our schools

definition: to make a din (see din entry 1 sense 1)
examples: The children clamored around them, singing songs and laughing.

definition: to utter or proclaim insistently and noisily
to influence by means of clamor
